node.title: Venezuela claims Guinness World Record for largest orchestra
node.description: Venezuela's National System of Youth and Children's Orchestras sets a new Guinness World Record for the largest orchestra, with 8,573 musicians playing simultaneously.

node.title: China reduces diplomatic ties with Lithuania over opening of Taiwan office
node.description: In retaliation for Lithuania allowing Taiwan to open a representative office in its capital city, Vilnius, China reduces the level of its diplomatic relations with the Baltic nation to below ambassador level.

node.title: Phillie Phavorite: Bryce Harper Wins N.L. M.V.P. Award
node.description: Snubbed at the All-Star Game, Harper exploded in the second half, earning his second career M.V.P.  Award.

node.title: Chile voters go to polls amid deep divisions
node.description: Chile was long held up as a model of political stability and economic growth in South America, but that image was shattered when violent anti-government protests began to spread though the country in…

node.title: After a Year Off, and an Off Year, Ivy League Crowns Familiar Champions
node.description: The only Division I league to not play football last season because of the pandemic, the Ivy League endured an unusual journey of virus disruptions in its return.

node.title: Red-hot Perth Scorchers to host WBBL final after smashing Sydney Sixers
node.description: The WBBL final will be played at Perth Stadium next Saturday after the Scorchers clinched top spot with a comfortable eight-wicket win over the Sydney Sixers.

node.title: More than 1,500 Queensland drivers caught with phones in just one week
node.description: Dozens of offenders were caught breaking new road rules multiple times in the first four days of November. If the trend continues, the government warns 12 drivers could lose their licence each day.

node.title: Zverev Shuts Down Djokovic, Will Meet Medvedev in the ATP Tour Finals
node.description: The world No. 1 is increasingly under threat on hardcourts from younger, taller players — like the two men who will play in the finals on Sunday.

node.title: Queen Elizabeth II marks first wedding anniversary without Prince Philip
node.description: Queen Elizabeth II marks her first wedding anniversary alone, seven months after the death of her husband of 73 years, Prince Philip.

node.title: 'Bring it on': Labor would welcome election fought on cost of living
node.description: Citing the rising cost of petrol and a drop in real wages, Shadow Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been "lying" about the economy, with "real consequences" for families.

node.title: Bar, beauty salon among new locations of interest reported today
node.description: A beauty salon and a bar are among new locations of interest reported today in Rotorua, Mount Maunganui and Kerikeri.

node.title: Killer eludes police for 31 years; one woman found him in 2 hours
node.description: Another woman's search to discover her roots leads to a shocking discovery: a killer in her family tree.

node.title: Having access to toilets is a basic human right, but for those with a disability, access is still a common problem
node.description: It wasn't until Robyn Thompson's multiple sclerosis progressed that future trips to the loo became a major part of preparing for any trip outside the house. She says the issue is all too common.

node.title: Surf lifesavers expected to wear masks during rescues
node.description: Surf lifesavers are expected to wear masks while rescuing people from the water.

node.title: Federer and Nadal voice concern for Peng Shaui
node.description: Tennis greats Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal voice concern for Chinese player Peng Shuai, as advocates call on the IOC to push China for proof of her safety.

node.title: Colombia president condemns Nazi-themed police event
node.description: Colombian President Iván Duque has condemned the actions of police cadets who dressed as Nazis as part of a ceremony meant to honour Germany.

node.title: Covid-19 vaccinations: South Canterbury hits 90pc, joining 11 other DHBs
node.description: The South Canterbury DHB has become the 12th in the country to reach the 90 percent first dose vaccination milestone.

node.title: Hamilton to wear rainbow helmet in middle east
node.description: Lewis Hamilton says he will wear his rainbow-coloured Progress Pride helmet over the next month to draw attention to LGBTQ+ intolerance.

node.title: Mooloo end title drought
node.description: Waikato have claimed provincial rugby's premiership for the first time in 15 years.

node.title: Protests erupt over COVID lockdown and vaccination rules across Europe
node.description: Tens of thousands of protesters, many from far-right groups, march in Austria and other European nations as COVID-19 restrictions tighten.

node.title: Onlookers delighted as dolphins make a splash at jazz concert
node.description: A curious dolphin has delighted onlookers during a jazz concert at an underwater observatory. And it's not the first time marine creatures have crashed the party.

node.title: 'Nothing's going to stop me': Queensland's Health Minister says she has received death threats
node.description: Yvette D'Ath insists she still feels safe in her ministerial role despite receiving death threats, saying she sees her role as extremely important and "I love what I do".

node.title: Live Test Rugby: France beats All Blacks by 15 points
node.description: The All Blacks' final Test of the year has ended in a heavy defeat, with France winning 40-25 in Paris this morning.

node.title: Victoria records four more Covid deaths and 1275 new infections
node.description: Victoria has recorded the deaths of four more people with Covid-19 and a further 1275 new infections.

node.title: Djokovic to "wait and see" about competing at Australian Open
node.description: Djokovic has refused to say if he's vaccinated — or if he intends to get vaccinated.

node.title: The Disappearance of Tanya Van Cuylenborg and Jay Cook
node.description: A young couple embarks on an overnight road trip and never returns. How did investigators finally find their killer?

node.title: Family of Elijah McClain to Receive $15 Million in Settlement
node.description: Mr. McClain, a young Black man, died in 2019 after being restrained by the police in Aurora, Colo.

node.title: Michael Flynn Claims Dems Plotting Financial Collapse to Stop Midterms, Control Society
node.description: "This is the plan of the Left...Get us to a place where we have just staggering financial problems, and so more control by the federal government must be put into place," Flynn said.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Awarded AR-15 for 'Defense of Gun Rights' Following Acquittal
node.description: Almost immediately after the shooting, Rittenhouse became an icon for gun groups and gun rights advocates.

node.title: 'I Am Not': Trump Lawyer Lin Wood Threatens to Sue Rittenhouse Lawyer for Calling Him 'Idiot'
node.description: Rittenhouse's lawyer criticized Wood for allegedly trying to profit off of Rittenhouse's imprisonment.
